description: This initiative includes policies that address National Security Scheme (ENS) controls specifically for the 'CCN-STIC 884'. This policy set includes definitions that have a Deny effect by default.

metadata.displayName: Self-attest or disable the execution of the policy
metadata.description: Self-attest or disable the execution of the policy

metadata.displayName: Audit if not exists or disable the execution of the policy
metadata.description: Audit if not exists or disable the execution of the policy

metadata.description: Audit or disable the execution of the policy

metadata.description: Audit, deny or disable the execution of the policy

metadata.displayName: Audit if not exists, deploy if not exists or disable the execution of the policy.
metadata.description: Audit if not exists, deploy if not exists or disable the execution of the policy.

metadata.description: Deny or disable the execution of the policy

metadata.description: Enable or disable the execution of the policy

metadata.description: Enable or disable the execution of the policy

metadata.description: Enable or disable the execution of the policy

metadata.description: Enable or disable the execution of the policy

metadata.displayName: Include Arc connected servers for Guest Configuration policies
metadata.description: Optionally choose to audit settings inside Arc connected servers using Guest Configuration policies. By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.
By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.
The Minimum password age setting determines the period of time (in days) that a password must be used before the user can change it.
The Maximum password age setting determines the period of time (in days) that a password can be used before the system requires the user to change it.
The Enforce password history setting determines the number of unique new passwords that must be associated with a user account before an old password can be reused.
The Minimum password length setting determines the least number of characters that can make up a password for a user account.
The list of locations where the policy should be applied.
Resource Id of the Data Collection Rule to be applied on the Linux Arc machines in scope.

metadata.displayName: Bring Your Own User-Assigned Managed Identity
metadata.description: If set to true, Azure Monitor Agent will use the user-assigned managed identity specified via the 'User-Assigned Managed Identity ...' parameters for authentication. Otherwise, Azure Monitor Agent will use the user-assigned managed identity /subscriptions/<subscription-id>/resourceGroups/built-in-identity-rg/providers/Microsoft.ManagedIdentity/userAssignedIdentities/built-in-identity-<location> for authentication.
The name of the user-assigned managed identity which Azure Monitor Agent will use for authentication when 'Bring Your Own User-Assigned Managed Identity' is set to true.
The resource group of the user-assigned managed identity which Azure Monitor Agent will use for authentication when 'Bring Your Own User-Assigned Managed Identity' is set to true.
Select the vulnerability assessment solution to provision to machines.
Select the vulnerability assessment solution to provision to machines.
The effect determines what happens when the policy rule is evaluated to match.

metadata.displayName: Location (Specify the location of the VMs that you want to protect)
metadata.description: Specify the location of the VMs that you want to protect. VMs should be backed up to a vault in the same location. For example - southeastasia.

metadata.displayName: Backup Policy (of type Azure VM from a vault in the location chosen above)
metadata.description: Specify the id of the Azure backup policy to configure backup of the virtual machines. The selected Azure backup policy should be of type Azure virtual machine. This policy needs to be in a vault that is present in the location chosen above. For example - /subscriptions/<SubscriptionId>/resourceGroups/<resourceGroupName>/providers/Microsoft.RecoveryServices/vaults/<VaultName>/backupPolicies/<BackupPolicyName>.
Name of the tag to use for excluding VMs from the scope of this policy. This should be used along with the Exclusion Tag Value parameter. Learn more at https://aka.ms/AppCentricVMBackupPolicy.

Value of the tag to use for excluding VMs from the scope of this policy (in case of multiple values, use a comma-separated list). This should be used along with the Exclusion Tag Name parameter. Learn more at https://aka.ms/AppCentricVMBackupPolicy.
Name of the tag to use for including VMs in the scope of this policy. This should be used along with the Inclusion Tag Value parameter. Learn more at https://aka.ms/AppCentricVMBackupPolicy

Value of the tag to use for including VMs in the scope of this policy (in case of multiple values, use a comma-separated list). This should be used along with the Inclusion Tag Name parameter. Learn more at https://aka.ms/AppCentricVMBackupPolicy.
Latest supported Python version for App Services
Latest supported Python version for App Services
Specify a supported Python version for App Service
Workspace resource Id of the Log Analytics workspace destination for the Data Collection Rule.
Region of the Log Analytics workspace destination for the Data Collection Rule.
Workspace Id of the Log Analytics workspace destination for the Data Collection Rule.

metadata.displayName: Enable collection of SQL queries for security research
metadata.description: Enable or disable the collection of SQL queries for security research.

Optional Log Analytics workspace resource id. If provided, will be used as part of the feature configuration. Otherwise, default workspace will be provisioned. Value format should be '/subscriptions/XXX/resourcegroups/XXX/providers/Microsoft.OperationalInsights/workspaces/XXX'.

The resource group name where the export to Event Hub configuration is created. If you enter a name for a resource group that doesn't exist, it'll be created in the subscription. Note that each resource group can only have one export to Event Hub configured.
The location where the resource group and the export to Event Hub configuration are created.

If a resource group does not exists in the scope, a new resource group will be created. If the resource group exists and this flag is set to 'true' the policy will re-deploy the resource group. Please note this will reset any Azure Tag on the resource group.
The data types to be exported. To export a snapshot (preview) of the data once a week, choose the data types which contains 'snapshot', other data types will be sent in real-time streaming.

Applicable only for export of security recommendations. To export all recommendations, leave this empty. To export specific recommendations, enter a list of recommendation IDs separated by semicolons (';'). Recommendation IDs are available through the Assessments API (https://docs.microsoft.com/rest/api/securitycenter/assessments), or Azure Resource Graph Explorer, choose securityresources and microsoft.security/assessments.
Applicable only for export of security recommendations. Determines recommendation severities. Example: High;Medium;Low;
Security findings are results from vulnerability assessment solutions, and can be thought of as 'sub' recommendations grouped into a 'parent' recommendation.

Applicable only for export of secure score controls. To export all secure score controls, leave this empty. To export specific secure score controls, enter a list of secure score controls IDs separated by semicolons (';'). Secure score controls IDs are available through the Secure score controls API (https://docs.microsoft.com/rest/api/securitycenter/securescorecontrols), or Azure Resource Graph Explorer, choose securityresources and microsoft.security/securescores/securescorecontrols.
Applicable only for export of security alerts. Determines alert severities. Example: High;Medium;Low;

Applicable only for export of regulatory compliance. To export all regulatory compliance, leave this empty. To export specific regulatory compliance standards, enter a list of these standards names separated by semicolons (';'). Regulatory compliance standards names are available through the regulatory compliance standards API (https://docs.microsoft.com/rest/api/securitycenter/regulatorycompliancestandards), or Azure Resource Graph Explorer, choose securityresources and microsoft.security/regulatorycompliancestandards.
The Event Hub details of where the data should be exported to: Subscription, Event Hub Namespace, Event Hub.

metadata.displayName: Status if Windows Defender is not available on machine
metadata.description: Windows Defender Exploit Guard is only available starting with Windows 10/Windows Server with update 1709. Setting this value to 'Non-Compliant' shows machines with older versions on which Windows Defender Exploit Guard is not available (such as Windows Server 2012 R2) as non-compliant. Setting this value to 'Compliant' shows these machines as compliant.
Enable or disable the Malware Scanning add-on feature
Enable or disable the Sensitive Data Threat Detection add-on feature

List of Kubernetes namespaces to exclude from policy evaluation. System namespaces "kube-system", "gatekeeper-system" and "azure-arc" are always excluded by design. "azure-extensions-usage-system" is optional to remove.
List of Kubernetes namespaces to only include in policy evaluation. An empty list means the policy is applied to all resources in all namespaces.
Label query to select Kubernetes resources for policy evaluation. An empty label selector matches all Kubernetes resources.

schema.description: A label selector is a label query over a set of resources. The result of matchLabels and matchExpressions are ANDed. An empty label selector matches all resources.

matchLabels.description: matchLabels is a map of {key,value} pairs.

matchExpressions.description: matchExpressions is a list of values, a key, and an operator.

key.description: key is the label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: operator represents a key's relationship to a set of values.

values.description: values is an array of string values. If the operator is In or NotIn, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist, the values array must be empty.

metadata.description: The RegEx rule used to match allowed container image field in a Kubernetes cluster. For example, to allow any Azure Container Registry image by matching partial path: ^[^\/]+\.azurecr\.io\/.+$ and for multiple registries: ^([^\/]+\.azurecr\.io|registry\.io)\/.+$
The list of InitContainers and Containers to exclude from policy evaluation. The identify is the name of container. Use an empty list to apply this policy to all containers in all namespaces.
The required resource logs retention in days

metadata.displayName: Optional: List of virtual machine images that have supported Windows OS to add to scope
metadata.description: Example value: '/subscriptions/<subscriptionId>/resourceGroups/YourResourceGroup/providers/Microsoft.Compute/images/ContosoStdImage'

metadata.displayName: Optional: List of virtual machine images that have supported Linux OS to add to scope
metadata.description: Example value: '/subscriptions/<subscriptionId>/resourceGroups/YourResourceGroup/providers/Microsoft.Compute/images/ContosoStdImage'

metadata.displayName: List of resource types that should have resource logs enabled

metadata.description: Enable Logs - True or False
Whether to enable metrics stream to the Log Analytics workspace - True or False
The list of allowed key types

This parameter checks if Immutability is locked for Backup Vaults in scope. Selecting 'true' will mark only vaults with Immutability 'Locked' as compliant. Selecting 'false' will mark vaults that have Immutability either 'Enabled' or 'Locked' as compliant.

metadata.displayName: Double encryption should be enabled on Recovery Services vaults for Backup
metadata.description: Check if double encryption is enabled on Recovery Services vaults for Backup.  For more details refer to https://aka.ms/AB-InfraEncryption.
Settings to disable or permanently disable Cross Subscription Restore. Please note that Cross Subscription Restore once permanently disabled on a vault cannot be re-enabled.
Settings to disable or permanently disable Cross Subscription Restore. Please note that Cross Subscription Restore once permanently disabled on a vault cannot be re-enabled.
A subnet with private endpoint network policies disabled.

This parameter checks if Soft Delete is 'Locked' for Backup Vaults in scope. Selecting 'true' will mark only vaults with Soft Delete 'AlwaysOn' as compliant. Selecting 'false' will mark vaults that have Soft Delete either 'On' or 'AlwaysOn' as compliant.

metadata.displayName: Private DNS Zone ID for backup
metadata.description: Specifies private DNS Zone ID required to resolve DNS to private IP for the Azure Backup service.

metadata.displayName: Private DNS Zone ID for blobs
metadata.description: Specifies private DNS Zone ID required to resolve DNS to private IP for the Azure Blob service.

metadata.displayName: Private DNS Zone ID for queues
metadata.description: Specifies private DNS Zone ID required to resolve DNS to private IP for the Azure Queue service.

This parameter checks if Immutability is locked for Recovery Services Vaults in scope. Selecting 'true' will mark only vaults with Immutability 'Locked' as compliant. Selecting 'false' will mark vaults that have Immutability either 'Enabled' or 'Locked' as compliant.

Value of the tag to use for including storage accounts in the scope of this policy (in case of multiple values, use a comma-separated list). This should be used along with the Inclusion Tag Name parameter. Learn more at https://aka.ms/AB-BlobBackupAzPolicies.

Value of the tag to use for excluding storage accounts in the scope of this policy (in case of multiple values, use a comma-separated list). This should be used along with the Exclusion Tag Name parameter. Learn more at https://aka.ms/AB-BlobBackupAzPolicies.
Mode required for all WAF policies

Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security uses the settings for the Domain profile to filter network traffic. If you select Off, Windows Firewall with Advanced Security will not use any of the firewall rules or connection security rules for this profile.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall (Domain): Behavior for outbound connections
metadata.description: Specifies the behavior for outbound connections for the Domain profile that do not match an outbound firewall rule. The default value of 0 means to allow connections, and a value of 1 means to block connections.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall (Domain): Apply local connection security rules
metadata.description: Specifies whether local administrators are allowed to create connection security rules that apply together with connection security rules configured by Group Policy for the Domain profile.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall (Domain): Apply local firewall rules
metadata.description: Specifies whether local administrators are allowed to create local firewall rules that apply together with firewall rules configured by Group Policy for the Domain profile.
Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security displays notifications to the user when a program is blocked from receiving inbound connections, for the Domain profile.

Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security uses the settings for the Private profile to filter network traffic. If you select Off, Windows Firewall with Advanced Security will not use any of the firewall rules or connection security rules for this profile.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall (Private): Behavior for outbound connections
metadata.description: Specifies the behavior for outbound connections for the Private profile that do not match an outbound firewall rule. The default value of 0 means to allow connections, and a value of 1 means to block connections.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall (Private): Apply local connection security rules
metadata.description: Specifies whether local administrators are allowed to create connection security rules that apply together with connection security rules configured by Group Policy for the Private profile.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall (Private): Apply local firewall rules
metadata.description: Specifies whether local administrators are allowed to create local firewall rules that apply together with firewall rules configured by Group Policy for the Private profile.
Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security displays notifications to the user when a program is blocked from receiving inbound connections, for the Private profile.

Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security uses the settings for the Public profile to filter network traffic. If you select Off, Windows Firewall with Advanced Security will not use any of the firewall rules or connection security rules for this profile.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall (Public): Behavior for outbound connections
metadata.description: Specifies the behavior for outbound connections for the Public profile that do not match an outbound firewall rule. The default value of 0 means to allow connections, and a value of 1 means to block connections.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall (Public): Apply local connection security rules
metadata.description: Specifies whether local administrators are allowed to create connection security rules that apply together with connection security rules configured by Group Policy for the Public profile.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall (Public): Apply local firewall rules
metadata.description: Specifies whether local administrators are allowed to create local firewall rules that apply together with firewall rules configured by Group Policy for the Public profile.
Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security displays notifications to the user when a program is blocked from receiving inbound connections, for the Public profile.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall: Domain: Allow unicast response
metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security permits the local computer to receive unicast responses to its outgoing multicast or broadcast messages; for the Domain profile.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall: Private: Allow unicast response
metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security permits the local computer to receive unicast responses to its outgoing multicast or broadcast messages; for the Private profile.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall: Public: Allow unicast response
metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security permits the local computer to receive unicast responses to its outgoing multicast or broadcast messages; for the Public profile.

metadata.displayName: Would you like to restrict specific IP addresses?
metadata.description: Select (Yes) to allow or forbid a list of IP addresses. If (No), the list of IP addresses won't have any effect in the policy enforcement
Array with allowed public IP addresses. An empty array is evaluated as to allow all IPs.
Array with forbidden public IP addresses. An empty array is evaluated as there are no forbidden IP addresses.

The resource ID of the virtual network subnet that should have a rule enabled. Example: /subscriptions/00000000-1111-2222-3333-444444444444/resourceGroups/Default/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/testvnet/subnets/testsubnet
Private DNS zone to integrate with private endpoint.
Diagnostic Setting Name
Diagnostic category group - none, audit, or allLogs.
Resource Location List to send logs to nearby Log Analytics. A single entry "*" selects all locations (default).
Log Analytics Workspace
Resource Location must be in the same location as the Event Hub Namespace.

Event Hub Authorization Rule Id - the authorization rule needs to be at Event Hub namespace level. e.g. /subscriptions/{subscription Id}/resourceGroups/{resource group}/providers/Microsoft.EventHub/namespaces/{Event Hub namespace}/authorizationrules/{authorization rule}
Event Hub Name.
Full path (resourceId) to the storage account.
Profile name for the Azure diagnostic settings resource
DDoS Protection Plan resource to be associated to the virtual networks
